Class CurrentBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • CurrentBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class CurrentBox
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    CurrentBox displays current and torque as an animated line graph with a double y-axis. Stores points in two different arrays and updates/draws them alternatively depending on the value of the par (parity) variable - which is either zero or one. This was done to cut back on lengthy array updating functions.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      CurrentBox(int widthOfContainer, int heightOfContainer)
      Constructor sets preferred size to tell layout manager of LayoutContainerPanel how to draw this panel; Initializes chart size variables as well as milliampsE, milliampsO, millinewtmetsE, and millinewtmetsO (all to 0).

      • CurrentBox

        public CurrentBox(int widthOfContainer,
                  int heightOfContainer)
        Constructor sets preferred size to tell layout manager of LayoutContainerPanel how to draw this panel; Initializes chart size variables as well as milliampsE, milliampsO, millinewtmetsE, and millinewtmetsO (all to 0).

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Override of JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics). super.paintComponent() call fills background color. This is what is executed whenever repaint() is called in the program. Calls drawTab(int, int, java.awt.Graphics) to draw containing rectangle and shadow, draws chart image, then draws line graphs for current and torque.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context for drawing. Kind of a black box; gets handled in the background somehow

      • updateForDrawing

        public void updateForDrawing()
        Gets current and torque values from GUISerialPort.data and updates milliampsE, milliampsO, millinewtmetsE, and millinewtmetsO. Called by actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent).

      • drawTab

        public void drawTab(int width,
                    int height,
                    java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the containing rectangle and shadow. Called by paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics).
        Parameters:
        width - Width of rectangle available to draw in
        height - Height of rectangle available to draw in
        g - Graphics context to draw with.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Specifies how to respond to timer events from GUITimer. This panel uses events as a signal to call updateForDrawing() and repaint.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        evt - The timer event (not important to code but required by java.awt.event#ActionListener interface)
